headers.subject: [INUG-Users] Netcool Probe Failover Issue
headers.received: from 1upmc-msx-pp3.isdip.upmc.edu (1upmc-msx-pp3.upmc.edu [128.147.16.134]) by mx1.domainmail.org (Postfix) with ESMTP id CCC3A254096 for <users@netcoolusers.org>; Wed, 7 Nov 2007 16:52:49 -0500 (EST)

from 1upmc-msximc2.isdip.upmc.edu (1upmc-msximc2.isdip.upmc.edu [128.147.18.40]) by 1upmc-msx-pp3.isdip.upmc.edu (8.13.8/8.13.8) with ESMTP id lA7Lqe5d002425 for <users@netcoolusers.org>; Wed, 7 Nov 2007 16:52:41 -0500

body.para: Has anyone noticed the following issue when the setup the Probe server in a failover configuration?
We have certain source tools such as ITM, ITCAM, MOM which can forward events only to 1 probe server. This is a major issue for us, as we currently use The Failover configuration.
Below is an example of what we run into our production system:
SNMP traps are send to Primary Probe server(Box 1) and the Failover Probe server(Box 2)
ITM, ITCAM and MOM events are forwarded only to the Primary Probe server (Box 1)

All works fine when Box 1 is up and running, but if Box 1 ever goes down we loose all the events that are send from ITM, ITCAM and MOM until Box 1 is restarted. Also the whole purpose of us using the failover Probe server was so that we don't loose any events when the primary probe server goes down.
So is there a way for us to tackle this from Netcool Omnibus?
Thank you very much for any details that anyone can provide
